activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas P Dyson

defendant.name: Dyson, Douglas P
defendant.address: 620 W Allen St; 3, Rice Lake, WI 54868

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:15 AM Defendant Douglas P Dyson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rockow appears for today only. Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.   DE relates he has attempted to contact PD office but was unsuccessful.   Attorney Rockow relates DE qualifies for PD representation.  AIA requested.  AIA set for November 9th at 10:00 AM.  If DE is transferred to another facility, he may appear by Zoom Video to next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:25 PM Defendant Douglas P Dyson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Alex Kitto appears (for today) by zoom video.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint.
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility; call before leaving jail. If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney; complete before leaving justice center - if do not qualify for Public Defender services)

AIA set; must appear in person.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
